item.title: Kazuaki Ono's photo exhibition Southern Crust melds Australian scenery with our bakery culture
item.description: Kazuaki Ono wanted to entice people from Japan to visit Australia by showing we have as much to offer with our food culture as we do with our iconic scenery.

item.title: The best documentaries to binge in the weird week after Christmas
item.description: Summer is here and so are those long leisurely days of nothing following Christmas. Here are five documentaries that will help you while away the time.

item.title: Australia's batting headaches masked again by dismal English failure on wild Ashes Boxing Day
item.description: Australia's batting order is unsettled, unbalanced and out of form, but it matters little as England throws in the towel and considers the challenge of a Boxing Day Ashes Test all too hard.

item.title: Zelenskyy plans to meet with Trump as peace plan with Russia inches closer
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he is planning to meet with US President Donald Trump on Sunday to search for ways to end the war with Russia.

item.title: At least 14 injured in a knife and chemical attack at factory in Japan
item.description: A man has been arrested after stabbing eight people at a factory in the Japanese city of Mishima.

item.title: Today in history, December 27: Benazir Bhutto assasinated at election rally by teenage militant
item.description: During the tense campaign for her third term as prime minister of Pakistan, Benazir Bhutto survived one attempt on her life before she was shot dead by a teenage suicide bomber on December 27, 2007. She helped to build a political dynasty that continues.

item.title: ABC 50/50 Megaquiz: This week we're testing your knowledge on Die Hard, pizza and princesses
item.description: Every question has only two options: one is right and the other is wrong. You have an even chance of guessing correctly each time.

item.title: A quick guide to the best fabrics and fibres for summer and their sustainability
item.description: What our clothes are made of can make a big difference when it comes to keeping cool, but not all fabrics are created equal. Here is what to look for — and avoid — during the warmer months.

item.title: 25 years on, the search continues for stars of the Sydney Olympics' closing ceremony
item.description: For Trevor Harvey, honouring a departed mate meant one thing — finding a 6-metre-tall Kewpie doll from the Sydney Olympics.

item.title: Sydney to Hobart race crews doing it tough in challenging conditions
item.description: Crews are battling sea sickness and tough conditions as teams head for the finish in the 2025 Sydney to Hobart yacht race.

item.title: Aboriginal community tension in Victoria's north amid health board division
item.description: An annual meeting to elect a new board at Mallee District Aboriginal Services has led to divisions among members and incoming board members as the chair announces elections will be re-run.

item.title: When green energy threatens what it is meant to save
item.description: In a tiny town near the Victoria–South Australia border, a proposed wind farm near a protected wetland is posing a big question for Australia's planning regulators.

item.title: The best vantage points and everything else you need to know about Sydney's New Year's Eve fireworks
item.description: Sydney's New Year's Eve celebrations will this year pay tribute to the victims of the Bondi terror attack, with events to feature a heavy police presence. Here is everything you need to know to plan your night.

item.title: South Australian playwright pays tribute to late partner in new production
item.description: An upcoming South Australian playwright was writing a horror, comedy show about the prospect of losing a much older partner, then it happened to him.

item.title: Australian medical history – the heart donor who still walks the earth 20 years later
item.description: Lucinda is a member of an exclusive club — living heart donors, and is the only woman to have a baby after a heart-lung-liver transplant

item.title: 13 long reads to catch up on for your summer holiday
item.description: Here we've gathered a bunch of other things to read while you're relaxing over summer.

item.title: Ladybirds set loose at Australian Parliament House in Canberra over summer to take out pests
item.description: When politicians and most staff are away for the summer holidays, a ravenous group of fly-in workers descend on Parliament House.

item.title: Man charged with string of offences after burglaries that began on Christmas Day
item.description: A man is arrested following a Melbourne crime spree that allegedly began about 7pm on Christmas Day and ended with burglaries of two restaurants about 6:30am on Boxing Day.

item.title: Northern parts of Queensland bracing for heavy rainfall, potential flooding
item.description: Holiday travellers are being urged to check road closures before setting off on their journey, with parts of the state expecting rain into the middle of next week.

item.title: 175-year-old Nor' West Bend Station reopened to public after decades of restoration work
item.description: History is being brought back to life at a former pastoral station that has seen drought, boom and bust over the course of its 175 years.

item.title: Somalia, Arab nations denounce Israeli recognition of Somaliland
item.description: Matters of strategy are behind Israel's drive to recognise Somaliland, analysts say, as Arab nations worry about instability in the region.

item.title: Myanmar's first election in five years begins – but experts warn it's a sham
item.description: Five years after the military toppled a democratically elected government and imprisoned its leaders, the country is preparing to hold national elections beginning on December 28.

item.title: Trio of retirees from Dongara win award for community rubbish collection
item.description: Armed with gloves, bags, buckets and tongs, a trio of passionate rubbish removalists have picked up an award in this regional Western Australia town.

item.title: Storm Hunter returns for the Australian summer targeting a top doubles ranking
item.description: Popular Australian Storm Hunter is back from injury and adamant she can return to the form that made her the world's top-ranked doubles player.

item.title: Australians are drinking less, but one cohort won't give up the booze
item.description: Health-conscious Australians may be thinking twice about having that first or second beer, but not all of us are getting the message when it comes to alcohol and risky drinking.

item.title: China hits US defence firms with sanctions over arms sales to Taiwan
item.description: China urged the US to "stop the dangerous moves of arming Taiwan" after its multi-billion-dollar sale of weapons last week.

item.title: How a tsunami in Sri Lanka sparked a push to prevent drowning
item.description: What began as tsunami relief, has become something more powerful — teaching children not to fear the water that surrounds them.

item.title: Thailand and Cambodia agree to ceasefire, ending weeks of clashes
item.description: The ceasefire will take effect on Saturday at noon local time, in a conflict which has displaced more than half a million people on both sides.

item.title: Urban water restrictions likely across Victoria as dam levels drop and dry summer predicted
item.description: Victoria's water storage levels have dropped to 61 per cent capacity after most of the state recorded below average rainfall in 2025.

item.title: Robots, AI and 'smart tourism' will change how we travel
item.description: Will new technology lead to streamlined service and stress-free travel, or will it fundamentally change tourism and tourist destinations?

item.title: Police overseeing Bondi terror response investigate tattooed man at Newcastle beach
item.description: Police overseeing the response to the Bondi terror attack are investigating after a man was seen at a NSW beach allegedly showing a tattoo of a banned Nazi symbol.

item.title: Hobart family reunited with dog nearly four years after it disappeared from home
item.description: A blurry photo on social media has led to a Hobart family reuniting with their missing dog nearly four years after it vanished from their home.

item.title: Australia belted, England vindicated and Test cricket wounded in MCG Ashes Test farce
item.description: As England deservedly celebrates a long-awaited Test win in Australia, everyone else involved counts the cost of a farcical and damaging two-day disaster at the MCG.

item.title: Three charged after fatal Christmas Eve stabbing in Perth suburb of Aubin Grove
item.description: Three males are charged over the fatal stabbing of a 19-year-old in the Perth southern suburb of Aubin Grove on Christmas Eve.

item.title: Ashes 2025: Calls for MCG Boxing Day Test pitch to be rated 'poor' as England and Australia batting criticised
item.description: After the first Test of the Ashes series sensationally ended in just two days, Cricket Australia hoped it wouldn't see that again for a century. It's happened again five weeks later.

item.title: The vibe shift is here and it's not what we expected
item.description: From the rise of misinformation and AI to escalating political tensions, vast economic disparity, and the erosion of social bonds, the vibe shift is now understood as a deep, unsettling change in our collective reality.

item.title: Today in History: Top-secret Manhattan Project quietly approved
item.description: On December 28, 1942, a US president formally approved an investment in the top-secret project to create nuclear weapons.

item.title: Hard Quiz tournament: Think you are good at quizzes? I dare you to try these 50 questions
item.description: Looking to settle who is the smartest in your family? Challenge them to a Hard Quiz tournament: five rounds, 50 questions.

item.title: Steroid use is 'exploding' — but there are no clinical guidelines on how to quit
item.description: A rising number of Australians are using steroids. But one expert says a lack of knowledge and widespread stigma make it tough to get clinical support.

item.title: Parents in China use AI technology to monitor children's homework
item.description: AI is becoming a regular presence at homework time in many Chinese households. Experts say where families draw the line matters more than the technology itself.

item.title: More than a quarter of Sydney to Hobart fleet retires as leaders head down Tasmania's east coast
item.description: Crews have been battling challenging conditions, damage and sea sickness as the leading yachts are expected to arrive in Hobart later today.

item.title: Cyber attacks that occurred this year and how you can protect your data
item.description: More than 500 data breaches were reported in Australia over the first half of 2025 alone, but there are some ways you can minimise your risk of being caught up in one.

item.title: How the teen social media ban is impacting Australia’s multicultural communities
item.description: Sydney teenager Ilia Kyrychenko was relieved to delete his accounts after the social media ban, but the change is making it more difficult to connect with his loved ones in Ukraine.

item.title: Brisbane Heat beats Adelaide Strikers by seven runs, thanks to debutant Tom Balkin
item.description: Injury to Shaheen Afridi leaves debutant Tom Balkin to bowl the final over, and the 21-year-old delivers to help Brisbane Heat to a seven-run BBL win over Adelaide Strikers.

item.title: Experts say climate change bigger threat to biodiversity than renewable energy projects
item.description: As the green energy boom gathers pace, experts say climate change is a bigger threat to biodiversity than wind farms and other renewables projects.

item.title: Man charged with two counts of murder after stabbing at Quakers Hill in Sydney
item.description: Emergency services were called to a Quakers Hill home just before 5am after reports of a disturbance to discover a woman dead and a man fatally wounded.

item.title: Matthew Hauser became world triathlon champion in 2025. Now, he wants to win Olympic gold for Australia
item.description: Matthew Hauser has always dreamed of becoming a triathlete. After achieving incredible feats this year, the world champion is now eyeing a spot on the Australian Olympic squad.

item.title: What was on summer reading lists 100 years ago, in 1925?
item.description: There are books from authors that would become household names — F. Scott Fitzgerald and A.A Milne among them — and books that are now banned in some countries. But what can we learn from what people were reading in 1925?

item.title: Mentors gave me confidence to navigate life with a disability. Now I'm giving back
item.description: Other people with lived experience of blindness gave ABC reporter Nas Campanella the confidence to navigate life. Her mentee, Lily, is enjoying similar benefits.

item.title: NTFL umpires say FIFO growth to blame for declining standards
item.description: Jared Collins has officiated nearly a thousand NT footy games, but says an ongoing dispute between AFLNT and its umpires has forced him to hang up the whistle.

item.title: A rescued dingo puppy explores its new surroundings.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Dingo management should be 'non-lethal', traditional owners say
item.description: When Sonya sees a black-and-tan dingo, she feels a connection to family and Country, but many landholders see them as livestock-killing pests. Can graziers and dingoes co-exist?

item.title: Kennedy Center boss criticises musician who cancelled performance after Trump rebrand
item.description: Musician Chuck Redd cancelled his Christmas Eve show days after the White House announced the venue would be renamed the Trump Kennedy Center.

item.title: Weatherald, Labuschagne, Green under Ashes selection pressure after MCG loss
item.description: Jake Weatherald, Marnus Labuschagne and Cameron Green all face selection pressure following double failures in Australia's jarring loss at the MCG.

item.title: What to know about the Islamic State militants targeted by US air strikes
item.description: With US President Donald Trump hinting at plans for further strikes on IS militants in Nigeria, here's a rundown on what you need to know about the conflict.

item.title: Hands-on memories spark connection for dementia residents at western NSW aged care home
item.description: Creating meaningful, sensory activities for people living with dementia can be challenging, particularly when many traditional options feel more suited to children than adults with a lifetime of lived experience behind them.

item.title: Police investigate death of woman in Port Macquarie
item.description: A crime scene has been established after a woman died from unexplained injuries in New South Wales.

item.title: Man charged for allegedly displaying hate symbol tattoos at Newcastle beach
item.description: A man has been charged for allegedly displaying what police have called "hate symbol" tattoos at a beach in Newcastle.

item.title: Rockingham's leap to major AUKUS defence hub leaves some locals trepidatious
item.description: Rockingham in Perth's south is fast becoming a crucial part of the AUKUS nuclear submarine deal, with promises of a big boost in jobs and infrastructure — but it's also leaving residents afraid for their lives and lifestyle.

item.title: From soapboxes to social media: Two artists shaping Queensland's bush art scene
item.description: Marion Moore is 101. Zarabella Bambling is 23. Despite their differences, both women have just celebrated the same major achievement as bush artists.

item.title: Veteran train driver calls time on 70-year career that 'will never happen again'
item.description: Peter Sawtell remembers making friends and enemies, keeping fit behind a diesel engine, and even meeting King Charles III during his "legendary" career.

item.title: Former Australian fast bowler Brett Lee inducted into the Australian Cricket Hall of Fame
item.description: Renowned for his express pace, former fast bowler Brett Lee is the latest inductee into the Australian Cricket Hall of Fame.

item.title: The case of the Guayaquil Four places scrutiny on Ecuador's security crackdown
item.description: In the weeks before Christmas, four boys under 16 left home to play a game of soccer. Their forced disappearance at the hands of Ecuador's military has been labelled a national "turning point".

item.title: Spanish soccer coach missing after tourist boat sinks in Indonesia's Komodo National Park
item.description: The Labuan Bajo port authority attributes the sinking to high waves of up to three metres, but rescuers say they are "determined" to find survivors.

item.title: 'Grumpy' seal disrupts Blairgowrie boat race on Victoria's Mornington Peninsula
item.description: A wild seal dubbed "Grumpy" causes some commotion at an annual boat race on the Mornington Peninsula, outside Melbourne.

item.title: MCG curator Matt Page admits Boxing Day Test pitch 'favoured the bowlers too much'
item.description: MCC boss Stuart Fox staunchly defends chief curator Matt Page after a wild Boxing Day Test finishes within two days.

item.title: Man charged with assaulting Labor identity Tim Picton granted bail in Perth court
item.description: A 20-year-old man is granted bail after allegedly assaulting Tim Picton, a prominent Labor Party identity — an attack police prosecutors say may leave him permanently disabled, if he survives.

item.title: Coral Adventurer runs aground off Papua New Guinea with 120 people onboard
item.description: The Coral Adventurer has run aground off the coast of Papua New Guinea with more than 120 people aboard, two months after the death of a passenger allegedly left behind on a Great Barrier Reef island.

item.title: SA independent MP Nick McBride charged with assault
item.description: Police say they responded to reports of a domestic assault at a home in South Australia's south-east on Saturday.

item.title: Taiwan's cunning tax compliance makes most shopping receipts a ticket in a lottery
item.description: Most shopping receipts in Taiwan are also tickets for a lottery run every second month by the government to increase tax compliance, and there are some big prizes up for grabs.

item.title: Comanche takes out line honours in 2025 Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race — as it happened
item.description: Master Lock Comanche claims line honours in the 80th edition of the gruelling Sydney to Hobart yacht race, with a stunning daylight hours finish, making up for retiring early in last year's race.

item.title: Teenagers charged after alleged aggravated carjacking in Melbourne's south-east
item.description: An overnight police chase across multiple suburbs has ended with the arrest of three teenagers after an alleged aggravated carjacking in Melbourne's south-east.

item.title: Comanche wins Sydney to Hobart line honours
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Brigitte Bardot, iconic French actor, sex symbol and animal rights campaigner, dies aged 91
item.description: The French actor and singer was a screen siren of the 1950s and 1960s who in later life became a prominent animal rights campaigner.

item.title: Brigitte Bardot was the world's 'sex kitten'. Her nonchalance was all French
item.description: Few epitomised French chic like Brigitte Bardot, the doe-eyed beauty whose sensuality rocked a post-war world.

item.title: Families of Bondi victims call for federal royal commission
item.description: Loved ones of those killed and injured in the Bondi Beach attack say rising antisemitism requires a "powerful national response", piling pressure on Anthony Albanese for a royal commission.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios defeats Aryna Sabalenka in latest 'battle of the sexes'
item.description: Australia's Nick Kyrgios defeated women's world number one Aryna Sabalenka in the latest "battle of the sexes". The Aussie, who has fallen outside the ATP top 600 after barely playing for three years, won 6-3, 6-3.

item.title: A growing number of older women surfers are showing age is just a state of mind
item.description: When Katie Pahlow turned 60, she decided to finally bite the bullet and book herself in for some surf lessons.

item.title: Sarah Larcombe's journey back to the top of the paraclimbing world after devastating injuries
item.description: When Sarah Larcombe fell off Mount Arapiles in February, she thought she just sprained her ankle. What followed was months of ups and downs ending in a stunning world championships result.

item.title: Aid agencies fear lifesaving program banned in Gaza under new Israeli requirements
item.description: The Israeli government has introduced new rules for aid organisations, including that they must not engage in any activities or criticism which "delegitimise" the state of Israel.

item.title: Furious customers slam ASIC for ignoring Zone RV whistleblower complaints before collapse
item.description: Anger is growing after revelations the corporate watchdog failed to investigate allegations against luxury caravan manufacturer Zone RV.

item.title: Australia's driver courtesy wave dying out, say truckies, but experiment proves wave still alive on back roads
item.description: For generations, the courtesy wave has been etched into the Australian culture, but is it on the verge of dying?

item.title: Overall winner yet to be decided as Sydney to Hobart yacht race enters fourth day
item.description: The yacht race has entered the fourth day, after Master Lock Comanche claimed line honours late on Sunday.

item.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says progress made on peace deal, but Donald Trump says 'thorny issues' remain
item.description: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says a security guarantee between Ukraine and the US as part of a peace deal is "100 per cent agreed", while Donald Trump says there are still one or two "thorny issues" to finalise in the deal.

item.title: Concerns medical weight-loss treatments are being advertised to vulnerable eating disorder patients
item.description: Eating disorder bodies are raising concerns about weight-loss treatments being prescribed by telehealth companies, one of which ran a Black Friday sale to promote its services.

item.title: Young women join Country Women's Association Sydney branch in droves
item.description: More young women are joining the Country Women's Association's city branches, with a passion for jams and scones along with social connection and purpose.

item.title: Voter turnout lower than expected in Myanmar's first election since 2020
item.description: Myanmar's election has been widely dismissed as a sham by many governments and human rights activists who have said the military will use proxy candidates to legitimise their rule.

item.title: Travis Head happy to see out Ashes as Australian opener before working out future role
item.description: Australia star Travis Head says he is not precious about continuing to open the batting beyond this Ashes and will bat wherever the coaches tell him to.

item.title: AI powered 2025's economy to record highs. So why are only robots smiling?
item.description: This year saw economies survive tariff shocks and markets burst through record highs, but it doesn't feel like a party because so many people aren't invited.

item.title: Deadly varroa mite threatens half of Canberra’s beehives
item.description: A fast-spreading parasite is expected to devastate local bee colonies over the next two years, affecting commercial and backyard crops.

item.title: LGBTQIA+ focused boxing class combatting loneliness amid warnings about social isolation
item.description: One in three adults experience social isolation in what experts say is a "dangerous" issue in society. One suburban boxing group is working to tackle the issue, focused on the LGBTQIA+ community more at risk of loneliness.

item.title: Cyclone Hayley upgraded to category two system, as northern WA residents told to prepare
item.description: Residents in WA's north are on alert following the formation of Tropical Cyclone Hayley off the coast overnight.

item.title: Wet season's arrival prompts moves to shore up food security in Far North Queensland
item.description: Earlier this year, a once-in-a-century flood devastated Ingham and cut the main supply route between Cairns and Townsville. Now, as intense rainfall once again triggers multiple warnings and floods roads across northern Queensland, communities are taking steps to prevent another food shortage.

item.title: How vintage black-and-white films are making a splash back in colour
item.description: Would those classic black-and-white films be the same if viewed in full colour?

item.title: Australian rowers targetting Los Angeles Olympics after breakthrough medal in coastal beach sprints
item.description: After claiming Australia's first world championship medal in rowing coastal beach sprints, these athletes are turning their attention towards the LA Olympics.

item.title: Victorian master builder transforms Warrnambool house into castle for his son
item.description: They say "a man's home is his castle," but one builder from south-west Victoria has taken that literally when creating a dream home for his son.

item.title: Australia coach Andrew McDonald says Usman Khawaja will play the final Ashes Test amid retirement speculation
item.description: Usman Khawaja will play in the Ashes finale at the SCG, but Australian coach Andrew McDonald remains in the dark about the 39-year-old's future beyond that.

item.title: Anthony Albanese announces terms for Richardson review of Bondi terrorist attack
item.description: The PM says a former head of ASIO will assess whether multiple security and law agencies worked as effectively as they should have before the attack.

item.title: NT police arrest woman for allegedly stealing from patients in Alice Springs Hospital
item.description: A 30-year-old woman faces court after allegedly stealing from multiple elderly patients recovering from surgery in Alice Springs Hospital over an extended period.

item.title: Coolongolook Rural Fire Service volunteers 'gutted' after robbery during fire season
item.description: The volunteers discovered the theft when they arrived at the Coolongolook RFS shed to attend a car crash. Thieves stole hoses, breathing masks, radios and chainsaws.

item.title: Ahmed Al Ahmed recounts how he disarmed one of the gunmen in Bondi Beach terrorist attack
item.description: Father-of-two Ahmed Al Ahmed, who risked his life to disarm one of the Bondi gunmen during a terrorist attack, says he feels sorry for the 15 people who were killed.

item.title: The right way to stack your dishwasher and the verdict on rinsing beforehand
item.description: Rinsing can actually send a message to your dishwasher that your plate doesn't need as much washing.

item.title: Celebrating New Year's Eve in Melbourne? Here's how and where to bring in 2026
item.description: Half a million people are expected in the CBD as Melbourne farewells 2025 and ushers in 2026.

item.title: Stranded passengers to fly home from PNG after failed efforts to free Coral Adventurer
item.description: Passengers on the Australian cruise ship stranded off the coast of Papua New Guinea will be flown out of the country after efforts to refloat the vessel failed.

item.title: South Australian MP Nick McBride to remain in custody for next seven days
item.description: South Australian independent MP Nick McBride will spend the next week in custody, after being arrested and charged over the weekend.

item.title: China launches military exercise warning against Taiwan independence
item.description: China has moved its military to surround Taiwan warning against its independence. But Beijing's action has been condemned by Taiwan calling for regional peace and de-escalation.

item.title: Sydney to Hobart competitors tell of 'horrendous' conditions during 2025 race ordeal
item.description: Those now safely onshore after finishing the 2025 Sydney to Hobart tell of "horrendous" conditions, resulting in injuries, broken boats and seasickness — even among experienced crew members.

item.title: Prosecutors wrap up bribery investigation into South Korea's former first lady
item.description: Kim Keon Hee, the wife of disgraced ex-president Yoon Suk Yeol, is alleged to have accepted lavish bribes including fine art, jewellery and designer handbags, and to have meddled in state affairs.

item.title: Kempsey community marks 10 years since death in custody of David Dungay Jr
item.description: A decade after his death in a Sydney prison, David Dungay Jr's family hold with a memorial rally calling for change to a corrections system they say still fails to protect Indigenous people.

item.title: Slow TV for kids: Relax and unwind with low-stimulation shows on ABC iview
item.description: Looking for screen-time options that won't leave your kids overstimulated? 'Slow TV' shows, with their soothing visuals and soundtracks, could be the answer.

item.title: Ashes 2025: Sydney Test a golden opportunity for Cameron Green to belatedly shine in Australia
item.description: He has already proven his quality away from home, but heading into the final Test of the Ashes summer, Cameron Green remains in search of his breakthrough moment in Australia.

item.title: Legal loophole in Queensland's double jeopardy law closed
item.description: Last-minute amendments to Queensland's double jeopardy laws could allow for the retrial of botched DNA cases.

item.description: Hundreds of kilograms of shark heads have been left dumped outside the WA Fisheries minister's office in Margaret River, just three days before a permanent commercial demersal fishing ban comes into effect.

item.title: Menorah to light up Sydney Harbour Bridge on New Year's Eve after open letter from Jewish creatives
item.description: More than 30 Jewish-Australian creatives wrote to Lord Mayor Clover Moore on Monday morning, urging for a "Jewish-specific symbol" to commemorate the victims of the Bondi Beach terror attacks.

item.description: The ICC has handed down their verdict on the controversial MCG pitch which led to this year's Boxing Day Test wrapping up after just two days.

item.title: Thailand accuses Cambodia of breaching ceasefire deal after 250 drones flown over border
item.description: Bangkok has accused Phnom Penh of violating the peace deal that was struck on Saturday, after it claimed some 250 drones had been flown over the disputed border region.

item.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says US offers Ukraine 15-year security guarantee as part of peace plan
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has held talks with US President Donald Trump, and says he would prefer a commitment of 50 years.

item.title: Hamas confirms death of ex-leader Mohammed Sinwar and spokesman Abu Ubaida
item.description: In a statement, the Palestinian militant group also confirmed the death of spokesman Abu Ubaida.

item.title: Zelenskyy denies attacking Putin's Novgorod home with long-range drones
item.description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov says Moscow will review its position on a planned peace deal with Ukraine due to the alleged attack.

item.title: Today in History, December 30: Beatles star George Harrison stabbed at home
item.description: Unlike his former bandmate John Lennon, George Harrison survived an attack by a fan, but the musician's friends and family speculated it hastened his death less than two years later.

item.title: Remembering the celebrities and public figures who died in 2025
item.description: From actors and designers to a Holocaust survivor and a broadcaster, these people made their mark.

item.title: Your most read ABC News stories of 2025
item.description: It was a year that bought us a federal election, ongoing war in the Middle East and Ukraine and a trial in a small Victorian town watched keenly around the world.

item.title: What happened when we tested a 'safe' AI mental health chatbot
item.description: Is it possible to make a "safe" AI therapy bot? We tested the limits of a new Australian-designed chatbot that's been carefully designed not to hallucinate or be your best friend.

item.title: Household battery uptake booms on back of 'game-changer' rebate
item.description: Battery uptake is booming since the federal government rebate came into effect in July. Here's what you need to know if you are thinking of joining the thousands of Australians adding a battery to their home solar systems.

item.title: Commonwealth Bank convinced regulator to delay news it was breaking spam laws until after AGM
item.description: The Commonwealth Bank persuaded a key regulator to delay announcing it had broken spam laws until after its AGM, new documents reveal.

item.title: ASIC's remarkable turnaround as the tiger that found its teeth
item.description: After 20 years in the wilderness, the Australian Securities and Investments Commission's rehabilitation as a law enforcement agency seems almost complete.

item.title: Josh Burns on juggling politics and fatherhood and being a Jewish MP
item.description: In a broad-ranging interview for the Politics Now podcast, the rising Labor star reveals he plans to take extended leave to care for his baby daughter.

item.title: Police search for alleged carjacker who was fought off by bystanders in inner Melbourne
item.description: Police are looking for a man who allegedly tried to steal a woman's car in Richmond earlier this year but was foiled by bystanders, including one person wielding a golf club.

item.title: Broken Hill records seven earthquakes in 2025 — the most in recorded history
item.description: It is not unheard of for the ground to shake in Broken Hill, but what is unusual is the number of earthquakes recorded by Geoscience Australia this year.

item.title: Soft plastics recycling is back in Australia. How does it work and where does it go?
item.description: Australia's first large-scale soft plastics recycling facility is processing huge loads each day, turning waste into a useful raw material.

item.title: South-east Queensland's largest dam is 'full'. What does it mean?
item.description: South-east Queensland's largest water reservoir provides drinking water and protection from flooding. So, how does it all work?

item.title: Emergency warning issued as Cyclone Hayley nears WA's Kimberley coast
item.description: Tropical Cyclone Hayley continues to barrel towards the Dampier Peninsula on the Western Australian coast, where residents are being told to prepare for "severe impacts" when it makes landfall tonight.

item.title: Hobart Hurricanes beat Melbourne Renegades thanks to vital cameo from Matthew Wade
item.description: Matthew Wade's fuss-free cameo helps Hobart chase down the Melbourne Renegades's 163 at Bellerive Oval, lifting the Hurricanes well clear of the pack in second spot.

item.title: Hiker Stella Thurbon leads herd of goats on trek through Victoria's High Country
item.description: With bells tinkling, tails flicking, and panniers packed to the brim, adventurer Stella Thurbon has spent 26 days winding through the Victorian High Country with nine goats trotting faithfully behind her.

item.title: Noongar elders say WA prescribed burn went ahead despite warnings of cultural heritage sites
item.description: Elders on WA's south coast say they tried to warn the state government about unregistered cultural sites in the path of a prescribed burn, but the burn went ahead anyway.

item.title: Bushwalker survives 50-minute wait for antivenom after brown snake bites at Morton National Park
item.description: Swift-acting bushwalkers and emergency crews "absolutely" saved a woman bitten twice by an eastern brown snake as she hiked on the NSW south coast.

item.title: Donald Trump says US 'knocked out' a 'big facility' in Venezuela
item.description: A US strike on Venezuelan soil would be the first known land attack in the country since the Trump administration began ratcheting up pressure on its ruling regime, which Donald Trump accuses of "narco-terrorism".

item.title: Flooding, heavy rain and damaging winds hit north Queensland
item.description: North-west Queensland is on alert as flooding is expected to increase across northern parts of the state. The SES is sending additional crews to the outback amid flood rescues.

item.title: Victoria Police make more than 100 arrests, seize 30 weapons during first weeks of shopping centre operations
item.description: A 15-year-old carrying a hunting knife was among more than 100 arrests during the first few weeks of a police operation at four of Melbourne's biggest shopping centres.

item.title: Charles Darwin University researchers leading the way in fight to protect globally threatened rays
item.description: Australian researchers are leading the way in the fight to protect a group of globally threatened fish species, which look like "a shark and ray joined together".

item.title: Deaf people saying no to cochlear implants choosing 'different way of seeing the world'
item.description: Cochlear implants can be a life-changing tool for people with hearing loss, but some Deaf people argue their use risks compromising their community's identity.

item.title: Sportsbet fined $313,000 by NT Racing and Wagering Commission for 'systemic failure'
item.description: Australia’s largest online bookmaker has been fined $313,000 for breaching its licence conditions, in what one gambling researcher described as a "slap on the wrist".

item.title: How to protect against scams when buying and selling online on Facebook Marketplace and Gumtree
item.description: Savannah thought she had taken all the right steps to protect herself while selling items on Facebook Marketplace — but that did not stop her from being scammed. Here is what you need to know when buying and selling via online marketplaces.

item.title: Justice Department slammed for lack of strategic leadership as problems mount within WA prison system
item.description: A wide-ranging review into Western Australia's Justice Department finds that "forward planning is often overshadowed by immediate operational demands" which means it fails to address rising pressures like prison overcrowding.

item.title: Daria Kasatkina set for Brisbane International and Australian Open after mental health break
item.description: Daria Kasatkina is being backed to return from her mental health break and quickly become a fan favourite at her new home grand slam, the Australian Open.

item.title: How to celebrate New Year's Eve in Australia's capital cities
item.description: There are plenty of free events around the country to see out 2025 and welcome 2026. See what's happening in your city.

item.title: The importance of preparing for death and creating an end-of-life health care plan
item.description: Dying in sudden, unexpected circumstances is not something people often consider, but there are plenty of reasons to create an end-of-life plan. So why do so few people have one?

item.title: Donald Trump calls for Hamas to disarm after meeting with Benjamin Netanyahu
item.description: The US president has been hosting Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at his residence in Florida for talks on Gaza and several other issues.

item.title: Monday Finance with Dan Ziffer
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Overall Sydney to Hobart leader switches as boats race to get ahead of wind change
item.description: The two-person crewed BNC is the current favourite to secure an overall victory in the Sydney to Hobart, after crossing the finish line at 10:40 this morning.

item.title: Metal detectorist discovers 1880s Zanzibar coin at Port Macquarie beach
item.description: Metal detectorist Dale Oldham at first thought he had found a rusted Australian coin, until an online search revealed it was something much older and far more exotic.

item.title: NSW Parliament powerless to force witnesses to front inquiries after 19th-century laws struck down
item.description: The president of the NSW Legislative Council says he will not try to overturn a decision to strike down laws that purportedly allowed witnesses to be arrested for failing to appear.

item.title: It's backed by Maggie Beer and researchers alike, so why don't we eat more offal?
item.description: Despite becoming less popular in recent years, advocates like Maggie Beer say offal can be a delicacy.

item.title: Record number of NSW Police officers to patrol New Year's Eve events after Bondi terror attack
item.description: More than 2,500 police officers will be out in force at New Year's Eve celebrations in Sydney in a bid to bolster revellers' confidence in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: Boxer Anthony Joshua involved in deadly car crash in Nigeria
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Former boxing world champion Anthony Joshua stable, two people dead after car crash in Nigeria
item.description: Boxer Anthony Joshua escapes serious injury in a car crash in Nigeria that leaves two of his close friends and team members dead, a week after his multi-million-dollar fight with Jake Paul.

item.title: SA avoids major bushfire during extreme danger, but home and sheds destroyed
item.description: South Australia avoided a major bushfire as the state sweltered through a day of extreme danger on Monday, while two structure fires left a damage bill of $1 million.

item.title: China hasn't said it wants war in 2026. But it's showing the world it's ready for one
item.description: While Donald Trump was distracted, China launched its strongest-ever challenge against Taiwan. Beijing is showing it is ready for war.

item.title: No evidence Bondi attack gunmen operated as part of a terror cell, AFP says
item.description: AFP Commissioner Krissy Barrett says there is no evidence the men were instructed to carry out the attack, which left 15 people dead.

item.title: Bushfire near Rockingham closes Mandurah train line, Warnbro station in Perth's south
item.description: A major train line and Warnbro station are closed as firefighters battle a bushfire burning near Rockingham in Perth's south.

item.title: Ambulance Victoria reports increase in violence against paramedics over Christmas holiday
item.description: Ambulance Victoria says paramedics were assaulted, spat on and sexually harassed in a series of serious incidents over the festive period.

item.title: Shoppers spending billions on post-Christmas sales, but small retailers feel forgotten
item.description: Outlet centres around Australia were bustling on Boxing Day, but just down the road, some small retailers were feeling the sting. It's a trend that could shape the future of the Boxing Day sales.

item.title: Donald Bradman's baggy green to go under the hammer
item.description: A baggy green worn by Sir Donald Bradman during the 1947-48 series against India has gone to auction.

item.title: Nick Offerman hopes The Pout-Pout Fish delights tough child critics
item.description: This Australian animation stars an international and local voice cast led by Nick Offerman and Nina Oyama, who can't wait for children to see the film.

item.title: Coral Adventurer passengers begin journey home as cruise ship remains stranded on PNG reef
item.description: Passengers of an Australian cruise ship that ran aground off the coast of Papua New Guinea have begun their journey home, as efforts to free the ship remain unsuccessful.

item.title: Gold, silver and palladium prices pull back sharply, worrying some economists
item.description: The price of palladium — used in electronics — tumbles from recent highs while the prices of other precious metals, including gold and silver, have also sharply declined in recent days.

item.title: Women wearing hijabs targeted in anti-Muslim abuse post-Bondi attack, says Imams Council
item.description: There are concerns women wearing hijabs are bearing the brunt of a "horrifying" wave of Islamophobia in the wake of the Bondi Beach terrorist attack, with the Australian National Imams Council reporting a rise of hate incidents.

item.title: Floods across western and northern parts of Queensland
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Impact of abbreviated Boxing Day Test stretches far beyond the MCG
item.description: The economic and social impact of the Boxing Day Test reaches far past the pitch and the repercussions of the two-day finish rippled all across Melbourne.

item.title: Police search for alleged carjacker who broke into Latrobe Valley home with axe
item.description: Police are combing eastern Victorian bushland for a man they allege broke into a house with an axe and stole multiple cars in the Latrobe Valley.

item.title: MH370 vanished in 2014. A new search aims to find answers families desperately want
item.description: Malaysia Airlines missing flight MH370, which vanished in 2014, remains one of aviation's enduring mysteries. A new search is aiming to provide answers.

item.title: Russia's claim Ukraine attacked Putin's home 'doesn't make any sense', experts say
item.description: A defence analyst tells the ABC an attack on the Russian President's state residence would be "technically" possible but would not make sense strategically for Ukraine.

item.title: NT Environment Protection Authority orders Santos, Inpex licence conditions review
item.description: The Northern Territory environment regulator will re-examine the licence conditions of major gas facilities in Darwin, after one of its biggest operators admitted to under-reporting potentially toxic emissions at its Ichthys LNG plant on Darwin Harbour.

item.title: Khaleda Zia, Bangladesh's first female prime minister, dead at 80
item.description: Begum Khaleda Zia was leader of the main opposition Bangladesh Nationalist Party which was seen as the frontrunner to win the next parliamentary election in February.

item.title: Furniture factory destroyed by massive blaze in Sydney's south-west
item.description: More than 60 firefighters with 20 trucks were called to a factory in Greenacre just before 3pm on Tuesday.

item.title: Australian laws changed in six important ways in 2025
item.description: From food delivery to sovereign citizens, Australia's laws underwent some important changes this year.

item.title: Everything you need to know if you are headed to NYE fireworks
item.description: Where to watch, road closures and entry requirements for the hottest seats in town — here's all you need to know for the New Year's fireworks.

item.title: Adelaide public transport, stations and interchanges join list of declared public precincts
item.description: Police have been given expanded powers to search people for weapons on every public bus, train and tram in the Adelaide metropolitan area ahead of New Year Eve's celebrations.

item.title: The man was arrested in 2024 at his previous suburban residence for his role in the people smuggling scheme.

item.title: Australian people smuggling operation laid bare in NT Supreme Court
item.description: A brazen example of people smuggling has been recounted in the Northern Territory Supreme Court, after three Chinese nationals made it into Darwin Harbour on a small wooden fishing boat.

item.title: Here's what we know about the Coral Adventurer, the cruise ship that ran aground in PNG
item.description: The Coral Adventurer was carrying 80 tourists into the remote reaches of Papua New Guinea when it came to an abrupt halt on a reef off the Pacific nation's coast.

item.title: Bizzi Lavelle uncovers the hidden history of Blak burlesque in Australia
item.description: Bizzi Lavelle, a Queer Wakka Wakka and Arrernte writer and burlesque dancer known in the scene as Bizzi Body, is reclaiming the hidden legacy of this art-form one tassel twirl at a time.

item.title: Tasmanian youth alleged to have 'large amount' of child exploitation material on phone
item.description: Police have charged a southern Tasmanian youth after allegedly discovering a "large amount of serious child exploitation material" on his phone.

item.title: BNC, on brink of historic Sydney Hobart yacht race victory, faces a protest by rival Min River
item.description: The two-person crewed yacht on the brink of winning the prestigious overall handicap prize in the Sydney to Hobart race is the subject of a protest by a rival, which could potentially deny it victory.

item.title: Woodford Folk Festival's thirty-eighth year platforming Australian artists
item.description: More than 110,000 people have already walked through the gates of Woodfordia to be entertained by the 450-plus acts scheduled across the six-day folk festival — now in its 38th year.

item.title: Man in his 70s has died in floodwaters at Normanton in north west Queensland
item.description: Police were called to a vehicle submerged in floodwaters near Normanton where they found the man aged in his 70s.

item.title: Severe Tropical Cyclone Hayley crosses Western Australia's Kimberley coast
item.description: Severe Tropical Cyclone Hayley has been downgraded, after bringing severe winds and heavy rain to parts of the north-west Kimberley.

item.title: South Korea bans bear bile farming with jail for those who breach the law
item.description: South Korea is one of the few countries that allow farming to extract bile from bears, for traditional medicine or food believed to promote vitality and stamina.

item.title: Eurostar train services cancelled across Europe due to power issue
item.description: A disruption on Tuesday prompted the rail company to request train customers postpone their journeys until another time.

item.title: Christmas cruise ends in chaos as Coral Adventurer passengers return home
item.description: Around 80 passengers on the Coral Adventurer have been flown home after the cruise ship ran aground on a reef off Papua New Guinea.
